itemDescription: Northumbrian trade unionist and politician, died 1910

wikipedia_page.main: John Johnson (1850 – 29 December 1910) was a British trade unionist and Lib-Lab politician.

:1890: John Johnson

*The local Liberal Association selected 54 year-old John Johnson as their candidate to hold the seat. He was Financial Secretary of the Durham Miners' Association and a member of the Independent Labour Party. Educated at a local village school, he had worked as a miner for 30 years. He had also been elected to Durham County Council.‘JOHNSON, John’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2016; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 5 Jan 2017The Liberal Year Book, 1906 His candidacy was a recognition that a predominantly mining constituency should have a miners candidate.
